verses.verse: Now it fell on a day, <WH3117> that Jonathan <WH3129> the son <WH1121> of Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to the young man <WH5288> who bore <WH5375> his armor, <WH3627> "Come, <WH3212> and let us go over <WH5674> to the Philistines <WH6430>' garrison, <WH4673> that is on the other side. <WH5676>" But he didn't <WH5046> tell his father. <WH1>

Saul <WH7586> stayed <WH3427> in the uttermost <WH7097> part of Gibeah <WH1390> under the pomegranate tree <WH7416> which is in Migron: <WH4051> and the people <WH5971> who were with him were about six <WH8337> hundred <WH3967> men; <WH376>

and Ahijah, <WH281> the son <WH1121> of Ahitub, <WH285> Ichabod <WH350>'s brother, <WH251> the son <WH1121> of Phinehas, <WH6372> the son <WH1121> of Eli, <WH5941> the priest <WH3548> of Yahweh <WH3068> in Shiloh, <WH7887> wearing <WH5375> an ephod. <WH646> The people <WH5971> didn't <WH3045> know that Jonathan <WH3129> was gone. <WH1980>

Between the passes, <WH4569> by which Jonathan <WH3129> sought <WH1245> to go over <WH5674> to the Philistines <WH6430>' garrison, <WH4673> there was a rocky <WH5553> crag <WH8127> on the one side, <WH5676> and a rocky <WH5553> crag <WH8127> on the other side: <WH5676> and the name <WH8034> of the one <WH259> was Bozez, <WH949> and the name <WH8034> of the other <WH259> Seneh. <WH5573>
The one <WH259> crag <WH8127> rose up <WH4690> on the north <WH6828> in front <WH8127> of Michmash, <WH4363> and the other <WH259> on the south <WH5045> in front <WH4136> of Geba. <WH1387>

Jonathan <WH3083> said <WH559> to the young man <WH5288> who bore <WH5375> his armor, <WH3627> "Come, <WH3212> and let us go over <WH5674> to the garrison <WH4673> of these uncircumcised. <WH6189> It may be that Yahweh <WH3068> will work <WH6213> for us; <WH4622> for there is no restraint on Yahweh <WH3068> to save <WH3467> by many <WH7227> or by few. <WH4592>"
His armor bearer <WH5375> said <WH559> to him, <WH6213> "Do all that is in your heart. <WH3824> Turn <WH5186> and, <WH3824> behold, I am with you according to your heart."
Then Jonathan <WH3083> said, <WH559> "Behold, <WH5674> we will pass over to the men, <WH582> and we will reveal ourselves to them. <WH1540>
If they say <WH559> thus to us, <WH1826> 'Wait until we come <WH5060> to you! <WH5975>' then we will stand still in our place, <WH5927> and will not go up to them.
But if they say <WH559> this, <WH5927> 'Come up to us! <WH5927>' then we will go up; for Yahweh <WH3068> has delivered <WH5414> them into our hand. <WH3027> This shall be the sign to us. <WH226>"

Both <WH8147> of them revealed <WH1540> themselves to the garrison <WH4673> of the Philistines: <WH6430> and the Philistines <WH6430> said, <WH559> "Behold, <WH5680> the Hebrews are coming out <WH3318> of the holes <WH2356> where they had hidden themselves! <WH2244>"

The men <WH582> of the garrison <WH4675> answered <WH6030> Jonathan <WH3129> and his armor bearer, <WH5375> and said, <WH559> "Come up <WH5927> to us, <WH3045> and we will show you something! <WH1697>" Jonathan <WH3129> said <WH559> to his armor bearer, <WH5375> "Come up <WH5927> after <WH310> me; <WH3068> for Yahweh has delivered <WH5414> them into the hand <WH3027> of Israel. <WH3478>"

Jonathan <WH3129> climbed up <WH5927> on his hands <WH3027> and on his feet, <WH7272> and his armor bearer <WH5375> after <WH310> him: <WH5307> and they fell before <WH6440> Jonathan; <WH3129> and his armor bearer <WH5375> killed <WH4191> them after him. <WH310>

That first <WH7223> slaughter, <WH4347> which Jonathan <WH3129> and his armor bearer <WH5375> made, <WH5221> was about twenty <WH6242> men, <WH376> within as it were half <WH2677> a furrow <WH6776>'s length in an acre <WH4618> of land. <WH7704>

There was a trembling <WH2731> in the camp, <WH4264> in the field, <WH7704> and among all the people; <WH5971> the garrison, <WH4673> and the spoilers, <WH7843> they also trembled; <WH2729> and the earth <WH776> quaked: <WH7264> so there was an exceeding great <WH430> trembling. <WH2731>
The watchmen <WH6822> of Saul <WH7586> in Gibeah <WH1390> of Benjamin <WH1144> looked; <WH7200> and behold, <WH1995> the multitude melted away, <WH4127> and <WH3212> scattered. <WH1986>

Then Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to the people <WH5971> who were with him, <WH6485> "Count now, <WH7200> and see who is missing <WH1980> from us. <WH6485>" When they had counted, behold, <WH3129> Jonathan and his armor bearer were not there. <WH5375>

Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to Ahijah, <WH281> "Bring the ark <WH727> of God <WH430> here. <WH5066>" For the ark <WH727> of God <WH430> was with the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> at that time. <WH3117>

It happened, <WH7586> while Saul talked <WH1696> to the priest, <WH3548> that the tumult <WH1995> that was in the camp <WH4264> of the Philistines <WH6430> went <WH3212> on <WH1980> and increased: <WH7227> and Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to the priest, <WH3548> "Withdraw <WH622> your hand! <WH3027>"

Saul <WH7586> and all the people <WH5971> who were with him were gathered <WH2199> together, <WH935> and came to the battle: <WH4421> and behold, <WH376> every man's sword <WH2719> was against his fellow: <WH7453> a very <WH3966> great <WH1419> confusion. <WH4103>

Now the Hebrews <WH5680> who were with the Philistines <WH6430> as <WH8032> before, <WH865> and who went up <WH5927> with them into the camp, <WH4264> from all around, <WH5439> even they also turned to be with the Israelites <WH3478> who were with Saul <WH7586> and Jonathan. <WH3129>

Likewise all the men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> who had hidden <WH2244> themselves in the hill <WH2022> country of Ephraim, <WH669> when they heard <WH8085> that the Philistines <WH6430> fled, <WH5127> even they also followed hard <WH1692> after <WH310> them in the battle. <WH4421>
So Yahweh <WH3068> saved <WH3467> Israel <WH3478> that day: <WH3117> and the battle <WH4421> passed over <WH5674> by Beth Aven. <WH1007>

The men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> were distressed <WH5065> that day; <WH3117> for Saul <WH7586> had adjured <WH422> the people, <WH5971> saying, <WH559> "Cursed <WH779> is the man <WH376> who eats <WH398> any food <WH3899> until it is evening, <WH6153> and I am avenged <WH5358> of my enemies. <WH341>" So none of the people <WH5971> tasted <WH2938> food. <WH3899>
All the people <WH776> came <WH935> into the forest; <WH3293> and there was honey <WH1706> on <WH6440> the ground. <WH7704>

When the people <WH5971> had come <WH935> to the forest, <WH3293> behold, <WH1706> the honey dropped: <WH1982> but no man put <WH5381> his hand <WH3027> to his mouth; <WH6310> for the people <WH5971> feared <WH3372> the oath. <WH7621>

But Jonathan <WH3129> didn't <WH8085> hear when his father <WH1> commanded <WH7650> the people <WH5971> with the oath: <WH7650> therefore he put forth <WH7971> the end <WH7097> of the rod <WH4294> who was in his hand, <WH3027> and dipped <WH2881> it in the honeycomb, <WH3295> and put <WH7725> his hand <WH3027> to his mouth; <WH6310> and his eyes <WH5869> were enlightened. <WH215>

Then one <WH376> of the people <WH5971> answered, <WH6030> and said, <WH559> "Your father <WH1> directly <WH7650> commanded <WH7650> the people <WH5971> with an oath, <WH7650> saying, <WH559> <WH779> 'Cursed is the man <WH376> who eats <WH398> food <WH3899> this day. <WH3117>'" The people <WH5971> were faint. <WH5774>

Then Jonathan <WH3129> said, <WH559> "My father <WH1> has troubled <WH5916> the land. <WH776> Please look <WH7200> how my eyes <WH5869> have been enlightened, <WH215> because I tasted <WH2938> a little <WH4592> of this honey. <WH1706>

How much more, <WH637> if perhaps <WH3863> the people <WH5971> had eaten <WH398> freely <WH398> today <WH3117> of the spoil <WH7998> of their enemies <WH341> which they found? <WH4672> For now has there been no great <WH7235> slaughter <WH4347> among the Philistines. <WH6430>"
They struck <WH5221> of the Philistines <WH6430> that day <WH3117> from Michmash <WH4363> to Aijalon. <WH357> The people <WH5971> were very <WH3966> faint; <WH5774>

and the people <WH5971> flew <WH5860> on the spoil, <WH7998> and took <WH3947> sheep, <WH6629> and cattle, <WH1241> and calves, <WH1121> and killed <WH7819> them on the ground; <WH776> and the people <WH5971> ate <WH398> them with the blood. <WH1818>

Then they told <WH5046> Saul, <WH7586> saying, <WH559> "Behold, <WH5971> the people are sinning <WH2398> against Yahweh, <WH3068> in that they eat <WH398> meat with the blood. <WH1818>" He said, <WH559> "You have dealt treacherously. <WH898> Roll <WH1556> a large <WH1419> stone <WH68> to me this day! <WH3117>"

Saul <WH7586> said, <WH559> "Disperse <WH6327> yourselves among the people, <WH5971> and tell <WH559> them, <WH5066> 'Bring me here every man <WH376> his ox, <WH7794> and every man <WH376> his sheep, <WH7716> and kill <WH7819> them here, <WH398> and eat; and don't <WH2398> sin against Yahweh <WH3068> in eating <WH398> meat with the blood. <WH1818>'" All the people <WH5971> brought <WH5066> every man <WH376> his ox <WH7794> with him <WH3027> that night, <WH3915> and killed them there. <WH7819>
Saul <WH7586> built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> to Yahweh. <WH3068> This was the first <WH2490> altar <WH4196> that he built <WH1129> to Yahweh. <WH3068>

Saul <WH7586> said, <WH559> "Let us go down <WH3381> after <WH310> the Philistines <WH6430> by night, <WH3915> and take spoil <WH962> among them until the morning <WH1242> light, <WH216> and let us not leave <WH7604> a man <WH376> of them. <WH559>" They said, "Do <WH6213> whatever seems <WH5869> good <WH2896> to you. <WH3548>" Then the priest said, <WH559> "Let us draw near <WH7126> here <WH1988> to God. <WH430>"

Saul <WH7586> asked <WH7592> counsel of God, <WH430> "Shall I go down <WH3381> after <WH310> the Philistines? <WH6430> Will you deliver <WH5414> them into the hand <WH3027> of Israel? <WH3478>" But he didn't <WH6030> answer him that day. <WH3117>

Saul <WH7586> said, <WH559> "Draw near <WH5066> here, <WH1988> all you chiefs <WH6438> of the people; <WH5971> and know <WH3045> and see <WH7200> in which <WH4100> this sin <WH2403> has been this day. <WH3117>

For, <WH3068> as Yahweh lives, <WH2416> who saves <WH3467> Israel, <WH3478> though it is <WH3426> in Jonathan <WH3129> my son, <WH1121> he shall surely <WH4191> die. <WH4191>" But there was not a man among all the people <WH5971> who answered him. <WH6030>

Then he said <WH559> to all Israel, <WH3478> "You be on one <WH259> side, <WH5676> and I and Jonathan <WH3129> my son <WH1121> will be on the other <WH259> side. <WH5676>" The people <WH5971> said <WH559> to Saul, <WH7586> "Do <WH6213> what seems <WH5869> good to you. <WH2896>"

Therefore Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to Yahweh, <WH3068> the God <WH430> of Israel, <WH3478> "Show <WH3051> the right. <WH8549>" Jonathan <WH3129> and Saul <WH7586> were chosen; <WH3920> but the people <WH5971> escaped. <WH3318>
Saul <WH7586> said, <WH559> "Cast <WH5307> lots between me and Jonathan <WH3129> my son. <WH1121>" Jonathan <WH3129> was selected. <WH3920>

Then Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to Jonathan, <WH3129> "Tell <WH5046> me what you have done! <WH6213>" Jonathan <WH3129> told <WH5046> him, <WH5046> and said, "I certainly <WH2938> did taste <WH2938> a little <WH4592> honey <WH1706> with the end <WH7097> of the rod <WH4294> that was in my hand; <WH3027> and behold, <WH2009> I must die. <WH4191>"
Saul <WH7586> said, <WH559> "God <WH430> do so <WH6213> and more also; <WH3254> for you shall surely <WH4191> die, <WH4191> Jonathan. <WH3129>"

The people <WH5971> said <WH559> to Saul, <WH7586> "Shall Jonathan <WH3129> die, <WH4191> who has worked <WH6213> this great <WH1419> salvation <WH3444> in Israel? <WH3478> Far <WH2486> from it! <WH3068> As Yahweh lives, <WH2416> there shall not one hair <WH8185> of his head <WH7218> fall <WH5307> to the ground; <WH776> for he has worked <WH6213> with God <WH430> this day! <WH3117>" So the people <WH5971> rescued <WH6299> Jonathan, <WH3129> that he didn't <WH4191> die.
Then Saul <WH7586> went up <WH5927> from following <WH310> the Philistines; <WH6430> and the Philistines <WH6430> went <WH1980> to their own place. <WH4725>

Now when Saul <WH7586> had taken <WH3920> the kingdom <WH4410> over Israel, <WH3478> he fought <WH3898> against all his enemies <WH341> on every side, <WH5439> against Moab, <WH4124> and against the children <WH1121> of Ammon, <WH5983> and against Edom, <WH123> and against the kings <WH4428> of Zobah, <WH6678> and against the Philistines: <WH6430> and wherever he turned <WH6437> himself, <WH7561> he defeated them.
He did <WH6213> valiantly, <WH2428> and struck <WH5221> the Amalekites, <WH6002> and delivered <WH5337> Israel <WH3478> out of the hands <WH3027> of those who despoiled them. <WH8154>

Now the sons <WH1121> of Saul <WH7586> were Jonathan, <WH3129> and Ishvi, <WH3440> and Malchishua; <WH4444> and the names <WH8034> of his two <WH8147> daughters <WH1323> were these: <WH8034> the name of the firstborn <WH1067> Merab, <WH4764> and the name <WH8034> of the younger <WH6996> Michal: <WH4324>

and the name <WH8034> of Saul <WH7586>'s wife <WH802> was Ahinoam <WH293> the daughter <WH1323> of Ahimaaz. <WH290> The name <WH8034> of the captain <WH8269> of his army <WH6635> was Abner <WH74> the son <WH1121> of Ner, <WH5369> Saul <WH7586>'s uncle. <WH1730>
Kish <WH7027> was the father <WH1> of Saul; <WH7586> and Ner <WH5369> the father <WH1> of Abner <WH74> was the son <WH1121> of Abiel. <WH22>

There was severe <WH2389> war <WH4421> against the Philistines <WH6430> all the days <WH3117> of Saul: <WH7586> and when Saul <WH7586> saw <WH7200> any mighty <WH1368> man, <WH376> or any valiant <WH2428> man, <WH376> he took him to him. <WH622>
